wikipedia_page.main: Hugh Martin Murray (3 May 1912 – 6 January 2003) was a Scottish international rugby union player, who played for Scotland at centre. He was capped twice in 1936. He was born in Coatbridge.

link_mentions.page: List of Scotland national rugby union players

response: * Hugh Murray (judge) (1825–1857), third Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of California
* Hugh Murray (rugby union) (1912–2003), Scottish international rugby union player
* Hugh Murray-Aynsley (1828–1917), Member of Parliament in Canterbury, New Zealand
* Hugh Murray (York historian) (1923–2013), a pre-eminent British historian of the city of York
* Hugh Murray Shaw (1876–1934), Canadian federal politician
* Hugh Murray (rugby union) or Hugh Martin Murray (1912–2003), a Scottish international rugby union player
